decks.notes: This Bant Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and combat tricks. It includes cards that enable early aggression like Skrelv, Defector Mite and Jawbone Duelist, as well as removal spells such as Bring the Ending and Fading Hope to control the board. The deck also utilizes cards like March of Swirling Mist to buff your creatures and Serum Snare for additional removal options. Overall, the key strategy is to play aggressively and maintain pressure on the opponent to secure a quick victory.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the tempo of the game. By utilizing cards like Spyglass Siren and Deep-Cavern Bat to pressure the opponent early on, while also having removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down to deal with threats, the deck aims to maintain board presence and hinder the opponent's strategy. With additional cards like Faerie Mastermind and Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal providing strategic advantages, this deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells. The deck includes powerful creatures like Glissa Sunslayer, Mosswood Dreadknight, and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, supported by removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down. The deck also includes cards like Long Goodbye and Gix's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, with a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure a consistent mana supply.

The deck focuses on an aggressive playstyle using a combination of cheap removal spells and powerful creatures to control the board and pressure the opponent. It also includes cards that allow for card advantage and graveyard manipulation to maintain tempo and stay ahead. The mana base is built to support both black and blue spells, ensuring a smooth curve and consistent performance throughout the game. Overall, the deck aims to maintain early pressure, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and close out the game quickly with its powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful spells and creatures to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent. Key components include ramping with Fallaji Archaeologist and Nissa, Resurgent Animist, drawing cards with Memory Deluge and Brokers Hideout, and dealing with threats using Ill-Timed Explosion and Virtue of Strength. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with powerful plays and efficient removal. The combination of control elements and card advantage makes it difficult for the opponent to keep up with the tempo of the deck.

This deck focuses on utilizing a mix of control and ramp cards to quickly summon powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy involves generating a large amount of mana and then playing high-impact spells and creatures such as Burn Down the House and Nissa, Ascended Animist. By controlling the board and building up a strong field presence, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play through reanimation spells. It utilizes a variety of cards to help with card draw and graveyard manipulation, while also including threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Titan of Industry to apply pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and includes lands that can enter the battlefield untapped for maximum efficiency. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and powerful abilities.
